column1: The Taj Mahal is a white marble mausoleum located in Agra  India.
It was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
The construction of the Taj Mahal began in 1632 and took approximately 20 years to complete.
The exterior of the Taj Mahal is decorated with intricate carvings and inlay work.
The interior of the Taj Mahal is equally stunning  with a large central chamber.
The Taj Mahal is set in a large complex of gardens and reflecting pools.
It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is considered a symbol of India's rich cultural heritage.
The Taj Mahal attracts millions of visitors each year  making it one of the most popular tourist destinations in India.
Despite its popularity  the Taj Mahal is facing threats from pollution and erosion.
Efforts are being made to preserve this iconic monument for future generations.
